responses:
I'm David Clarke, a web developer originally from Roscommon, Ireland. Currently, I reside in Melbourne, Australia. I hold an MSc in Interactive Media from University College Cork, where I graduated with First Class Honours. I have a passion for both frontend and backend web development. I'm proficient in JavaScript, CSS, and HTML. I particularly enjoy working with React.js for frontend development and have completed projects using Node.js for backend development. Currently, I'm learning Python and Django to expand my web development skills. I love coding and working on exciting projects, always eager to explore and learn new technologies.

 Please feel free to ask me about some of these skills and technologies.

Hello! Nice to meet you. I'm here to answer any questions you have. I am a newly developed ChatBot created by David and may not have an appropriate response to all of your questions, but I will do my best!

I have a diverse set of skills in web development. I completed a Master's in Interactive Media at University College Cork (UCC) with First Class Honours. During my studies, I created VR Jam, my thesis project, which involved using TypeScript, Three.js, Tone.js on the frontend, and Node.js, Express.js, and Socket.IO on the backend. VR Jam allowed users to interact over the web in virtual reality and play real-time music together. It was an exciting project that demonstrated my proficiency in these technologies.

Since then, I have been continuously self-learning and improving my skills. I have gained expertise in Python, JavaScript, React, and Django. Additionally, I have worked on various projects involving APIs and even delved into machine learning.

Feel free to ask me more about any specific skill!

My ambition is to work as a full-stack developer in the future. Although I acknowledge that there is still much for me to learn, I am confident that given an opportunity, I can showcase my talents and make valuable contributions to a company. I have a keen interest in both frontend and backend development and have thoroughly enjoyed working on software development projects. I am constantly seeking new challenges and striving to expand my skills in order to achieve my ambition.

If you have any further questions or would like to know more about my skills, feel free to ask!

I have hands-on experience working with APIs to create interesting and functional websites. For instance, this chatbot that you're interacting with right now was created using the wit.ai API, enabling natural language understanding and response generation. Another project where I utilized an API is Art-Palette, which integrates the Unsplash API to generate art palettes based on user preferences. You can explore the Art-Palette project on GitHub: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Art-Palette.git)

I have extensive experience in backend development using both Python with Django and Node.js with Express.js. Python, along with Django, provides a robust and scalable framework for building backend logic and web applications. On the other hand, Node.js and Express.js offer a JavaScript-based environment that allows for efficient and event-driven backend development. One notable project where I utilized Node.js and Express.js was my thesis project, VR Jam. It involved creating a backend system to support the virtual reality experience. You can find more information about this project in my portfolio's projects section or explore the GitHub repository directly: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/VRJam.git)

CSS plays a vital role in web development as it allows me to style and enhance the visual appeal of websites, making them more user-friendly. I utilize CSS extensively in my projects to create beautiful and engaging designs. For example, the styling of this website you're currently browsing was achieved using CSS, in conjunction with HTML, JavaScript, and React. If you're interested in exploring the code and seeing how the website was styled, you can check out the GitHub repository: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Website-Development.git)

While I don't have extensive experience with specific deployment systems like AWS, I have successfully deployed several projects on personal domains. I have worked with Ubuntu servers to deploy projects on domains and utilized SFTP (Secure File Transfer Protocol) to upload files. I understand the process and requirements of deploying web applications and have hands-on experience in making projects accessible online.

I have a diverse educational background that has contributed to my skills in web development. In 2020, I completed a degree in Construction Management & Engineering from the University of Limerick. However, after careful consideration, I decided to pursue a career change that led me to the field of web development.

To further my knowledge and expertise in this area, I enrolled in a Master's program in Interactive Media at University College Cork. During this program, I learned various web development principles and acquired several valuable skills. I gained experience in scripting with Python, image processing with Python, prototyping with Java, iPhone development with Swift, and more. Additionally, I explored design concepts using Blender, audio processing with Logic, and video editing with Premiere Pro.

I successfully completed the Master's program with a First Class Honours, further solidifying my foundation in web development. If you have any specific questions about the skills I acquired, feel free to ask!

While I don't have any professional experience specifically in web development, I have worked in professional settings in the past, which has contributed to my overall skills and abilities. I have valuable experience as a production operator at Johnson & Johnson in Limerick, where I gained insights into working efficiently and effectively within a team-oriented environment.

Additionally, I served as a junior Project Manager for Townmore Construction in Dublin, overseeing the redevelopment of a major hotel in the city center. This experience allowed me to develop skills in project management, coordination, and effective communication.

To learn more about my overall experience and qualifications, you can refer to my detailed resume available at the following link: [GitHub Link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kSpHakbIRiE8FOFFsqaDTQ0f7hzUUDoR/view)

The main frameworks I use in my web development projects are React.js for frontend development and Express.js or Django for backend development.

I frequently utilize React.js to build dynamic and interactive user interfaces. In fact, this website you're currently browsing was created using React.js, along with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. If you're interested in exploring the code and seeing how the website was developed, you can check out the GitHub repository [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Website-Development.git).

For backend development, I have experience with both Express.js and Django. In one of my significant projects, my thesis project called VR Jam, I utilized Node.js and Express.js for the backend. You can find my write-up on the project on my website [GitHub Link](https://david-clarke.com/vrjam), and the corresponding GitHub repository for the project [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/VRJam.git). 

If you have any specific questions about my experience with these frameworks, feel free to ask!

I have experience in frontend development using JavaScript and TypeScript along with HTML and CSS. My preferred framework for frontend development is React.js.

I enjoy creating visually appealing and user-friendly websites. In fact, this website you're currently browsing was developed using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and React.js. If you're interested in exploring the code and seeing how the website was built, you can check out the GitHub repository [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Website-Development.git).

One project that showcases my frontend skills is Art Palette. It's a project where I integrated the Unsplash API to display random photos and generate their corresponding color palettes. If you'd like to explore this project and see how I implemented it using JavaScript, React.js, HTML, and CSS, you can find the GitHub repository [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Art-Palette.git).

Git is an essential tool for version control in software development, and I'm proficient in using it.

I utilize Git for managing my code repositories and tracking changes. I regularly use Git commands such as commit, branch, merge, and push to ensure a smooth and organized workflow.

If you're interested in exploring my Git repositories, you can visit my GitHub profile: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473)

I actively use GitHub to showcase my projects.

You can find my GitHub profile [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473). There, you'll find a collection of my open-source projects, code samples, and contributions.

Feel free to explore my repositories and discover the various projects I've worked on.

HTML is an essential skill in web development, and I frequently incorporate it into my development stack. It allows me to structure and create the foundation of web pages. In fact, this website you're currently viewing was made using HTML along with JavaScript, CSS, and React. If you'd like to explore the code and learn more about its development, you can check out the GitHub repository: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Website-Development.git)

While I don't have extensive experience with Java, I have worked with it in the context of Processing. Processing is a creative coding platform that utilizes Java for visual arts and interactive projects. I have created several projects using Java in Processing, showcasing my creativity and coding skills. One such project is Pronoun Usage, which can be found in the projects section of my portfolio. If you're interested in learning more about this project and exploring the code, you can find the GitHub repository: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Java-Pronoun-Use-Movies.git)

I have been working with JavaScript for the past two years and have gained proficiency in the language. When developing websites, I particularly enjoy using React, a popular JavaScript library for building user interfaces. For instance, I developed my personal website from scratch using JavaScript, HTML, CSS, and React. If you're interested, you can explore the GitHub repository for the website's development: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Website-Development.git)

I have extensive experience using Node.js and Express.js for backend development. Node.js provides a powerful runtime environment for building scalable and efficient server-side applications. Express.js, being a minimalist web application framework, complements Node.js perfectly, allowing me to develop robust APIs and handle routing efficiently. One project where I utilized Node.js and Express.js, along with Socket.IO, was my thesis project, VR Jam. The backend was developed using this technology stack to handle real-time communication and support the virtual reality experience. If you'd like to explore this project further, you can check it out on GitHub: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/VRJam.git)

This is my portfolio website! I created it from scratch using Javascript and React. Even this ChatBot was created by me from scratch using the wit.ai API. I have a few select projects on display on this site but I have many more on my github which you can find [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473)

I find Python to be a powerful language for software development and backend logic in websites. It offers a wide range of libraries and frameworks that enhance productivity. I have been exploring Python's capabilities in various domains, including machine learning. One of my machine learning projects is a music genre classifier, which you can check out on GitHub: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/music-genre-classifier.git). Additionally, I created a project for Ableton Live using Python, which allows for automation and streamlining of processes. You can check out the project on GitHub: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Automate-Ableton-Collect-And-Save.git). Furthermore, I have been learning Django to deploy my Python code to websites, enabling the development of robust web applications. Python's versatility and the Django framework provide a solid foundation for building powerful and scalable web projects.

I thoroughly enjoy using React as my primary framework for website development. React's component-based architecture helps me organize my code and maintain a clear and structured project. It allows me to create interactive and efficient user interfaces. In fact, this website you're currently exploring was created using React, along with HTML, CSS, and JavaScript. If you're interested in delving into the code and learning more about the project, you can check out the GitHub repository: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Website-Development.git)

If you'd like to take a look at my resume, you can find it [GitHub Link](https://drive.google.com/file/d/1kSpHakbIRiE8FOFFsqaDTQ0f7hzUUDoR/view). It provides detailed information about my education, skills, work experience, and contact details.

Please feel free to reach out to me using the contact form below or using any of my contact details provided in the resume if you have any questions or would like to discuss potential opportunities.

I have experience working with Swift, Apple's programming language for iOS development. I have developed multi-page applications and worked extensively with Core Data, a powerful framework for data storage and management. One notable project where I utilized Swift is the NBA App, which can be found in the projects section of my portfolio. The NBA App was created using Swift in Xcode, and it showcases my skills in building interactive iPhone applications. If you'd like to explore the code and learn more about the project, you can find the GitHub repository: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/Swift-NBA-Teams-App.git)

I have hands-on experience with Three.js, a remarkable JavaScript library for creating 3D web projects and virtual reality experiences. Three.js provides a comprehensive set of tools and features that make it easier to develop interactive and visually stunning 3D applications. In fact, my thesis project, VR Jam, extensively utilizes Three.js to create a captivating virtual reality experience. You can explore more about VR Jam in the projects section of my portfolio, or you can access the GitHub repository directly: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/VRJam.git)

I have experience using TypeScript for developing some of my larger scale and collaborative projects. TypeScript has been instrumental in helping me maintain code robustness and minimizing bugs. One notable project where I utilized TypeScript, along with Three.js, Tone.js, Node.js, Express.js, and Socket.IO, is VR Jam, which was part of my Thesis project during my Masters course. If you're interested, you can find more details about VR Jam in the projects section.


 Additionally, you can explore the GitHub repository for VR Jam: [GitHub Link](https://github.com/DavidC6473/VRJam)
